title: Short Replies
description: Short Replies are simple phrases that you can use to make your conversations longer.

conversations.usage: Use to agree with someone, and let them know you are listening (informal).
conversation: How do you like this weather?
I don't like it, it's  too hot.
But my kids like it. They like to go swimming.
Oh, where do you go swimming?
conversations.title: Mmhmm…

conversations.usage: Say when you hear some sad news, or feel sorry for someone (informal).
conversation: Not great, I didn't sleep much last night.
Are you working late again tonight?
conversations.title: Aww…

conversations.usage: Say when you hear bad news (formal).
conversation: Not good, my arm hurts a lot.
Are you going to the doctor?
conversations.title: I'm sorry to hear that.

conversations.usage: Say when you hear good news (informal).
conversation: Do you have any plans for the weekend?
Yes! I'm moving to a new apartment.
conversations.title: That's awesome!

conversations.usage: Say when you hear about really good news (formal).
conversation: Great, I got a new job!
conversations.title: Congratulations!

conversations.usage: Say when you hear something positive or interesting (informal).
conversation: What did you do this weekend?
I went to a movie on Sunday.
I saw the new Star Wars movie.
conversations.title: Cool

conversations.usage: Say when you are impressed or surprised by good news (informal).
conversation: Great, my son got into college.
I know, I'm really excited for him.
What college is he going to?
conversations.title: Wow!

conversations.usage: Use to let someone know you are interested, and want to know more (formal).
conversation: Good, I went to Sacramento yesterday.
I was visiting my aunt and uncle there.
conversations.title: Oh, interesting!
